meta.title: Home - South Texas Independent School District

meta.content: Home, South Texas Independent School District
Home - South Texas Independent School District
Home - South Texas Independent School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

li.a: South Texas ISD Rising Scholars Academy
South Texas ISD Rising Scholars Academy

img.alt: Students seen taking a photo in the hallway
Students seen working on science experiment
Girls volleyball team seen setting up a play during game
Instructor seen conducting a class lecture
Students seen engaged during class discussion
Students working on a science experiment

div.p: STISD is consistently ranked among the best in the state and nation.

img.alt: Students seen painting and work on art project

div.p: STISD is the only all-magnet school district in the state, and offers Valley students an educational alternative. The district provides a personal environment, a strong scholastic program and hands-on training in vocational career fields.
Because STISD is a public school district, there is no cost for students to attend one of its six campuses, and bus transportation is also free of charge.

img.alt: STISD instructor seen working with group of students on assignment

div.p: STISD schools maintain an open enrollment policy, meaning any student that wants to attend one of our six campuses can as long as he or she resides within the tri-county area we serve.

img.alt: Students seen socializing during transition periods

div.p: At STISD, meet curious, collaborative and driven students just like you.

img.alt: Health Professions boys basketball team seen scrimmaging

div.p: At STISD, there's more to experience than solely academics. Explore what life is like as an STISD student, and be part of the many extracurricular competitive activities and social clubs.

img.alt: STISD instructor seen giving a lesson

div.p: STISD seeks to employ individuals who are committed to serving students and our communities, and can help advance our goals of consistently learning and always innovating.

img.alt: Students seen working on science experiment

div.p: By being employed at STISD, one gains the opportunity and the responsibility to make a difference within the world of education and student growth.

img.alt: STISD alumnus leading students during externship opportunity.

div.p: The community here at STISD is diverse, interactive and vibrant. We take pride in each and every position that plays a part in making our district unique and consistently ranked among the best in the state and nation.
If you are looking for spunk and excitement and non-traditional methods of learning, the STISD community is the perfect match and offers endless opportunities.

of STISD graduates attend college/university | 1%: Military

img.alt: Students seen engaged during class discussion

div.p:
South Texas Independent School District (STISD) is now enrolling for the 2020-2021 school year at all six campuses – two middle schools and four high schools.
To be eligible, students must reside in Cameron, Hidalgo or Willacy County and complete the online registration application. Limited slots are available, and enrollment for each campus will close once the school reaches capacity. Students are accepted on a first-come, first-served basis.

article.a: Read More about Enroll STISD for 2020-2021

div.a: Meeting of the STISD Board of Directors
Meeting of the STISD Board of Directors
Meeting of the STISD Board of Directors

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: Based upon recent developments within our region, our state and our nation, the following adjustments are in effect for STISD:

ul.li: Schools will remain closed until further notice.
Instructional resources and/or support will be provided by your teacher or the campus principal.

The district will provide five days’ worth of breakfast and lunch meals through curbside distribution two days each week– Monday and Wednesday. Children are no longer required to accompany parents to pick up meals; however, parents will be asked to present documentation for their children. Please see the district website for further details.
Designated essential campus staff will continue to report to work Monday and Wednesday from 8:00 a.m.- 2:00 p.m.
Teachers will continue to prepare for potential long-term flexible learning by ensuring usage of a technology learning platform.
All staff members must be available remotely from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.
All departments will continue to provide campus support for our STISD Community.

div.p: During the school closure, STISD will continue to provide instruction to students through Flexible Learning, and will continue to serve meals at no cost to children ages 18 and under within our communities.
For more information on updates, flexible learning and meals, please visit our COVID-19 specific page.
Currently accepting applications for the 2020-2021 school year. To apply, visit our application site.
